intro: Aneilema trispermum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, velvety flowers. The plant typically features dark green, velvety leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Aneilema trispermum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
